author: dominik.tilman
title: Catalyst Outreach
description: どうすればより多くの人にProject Catalystに参加してもらい、カルダノの普及を加速させることができるでしょうか？

f6_assessments.q0:
Disclaimer: my view points are shaped by my multi-year experience in product management and software development.

The stated objective of bringing new participants and contributors into Catalyst supports the strategic goal of Fund8: prepare people willing to contribute.

At the same time, the proposal does not discuss excamples of historical success stories nor compares its expected effectiveness with other acquisition-focused challenges: regional (Grow LatAm, Grow India, etc.), gender (Women of Cardano), etc.

Based on my experience in product management and digital marketing, it easy to believe that marketing activities focused on a certain target group, can be more effective per $ of funds spent than more general ones. So, to make this proposal stronger, I'd suggest to include a deeper analysis of expected ROI in comparison with alternative approaches.

In addition, it can be worth considering to creating proposals within broader acquistion initiatives.

I have made the following deductions:
- 1 point because this initiaitve supports only one of three strategic goals of Fund 8.
- 1 point for the lack of a clear analysis of alternative approaches.
My rating is 3.
f6_assessments.q1:
Given the size and the diverse skill set of the Catalyst community, it's definitely possible to concieve and excecute additional marketing activities.

At the same time, the proposal would be stronger if it analyzed recent successful cases on brining new people into catalyst and discussed the sufficiency of funds to reach a noticeable impact.

I have made the following deductions:
- 1 point for the lack of a discussion about the sufficiency of the requested funds to achieve a noticeable impact.
My rating is 4.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposed metrics evaluate the growth of the community overall, but do not provide insights on the incremental contribution of the marketing activities in this initiative.

In addition, to make the proposal stronger, I'd suggest considering metrics that can evaluate the deep engagement of the newly aquired audience and the cost of acquisition, such as:
1) the number of apps per developer created by devs onboarded through theactivities.
2) the number of proposals per Catalyst participant for participants acquired through the activities.
3) cost per app created.
4) cost per proposal created.
5) comparison of the above metrics with alternative acquisition channels.

I have made the following deductions:
- 1 point for the lack of evaluation of the incremental contribution.
- 1 point for the metrics to analyze cost efficiency.
- 1 point for the lack of metrics to analyze the engagement of the onboarded audience.
My rating is 2.

f6_assessments.q0: Personally, I believe that this challenge should remain in the Catalyst cycle, even though we have come a long way and have exceeded our expectations in terms of participation, I believe that there is still a large part of society that needs to be included.  To accomplish Cardano's mission, this challenge is essential.
f6_assessments.q1: The community is capable of addressing this type of challenge; in the past, great initiatives to engage entrepreneurs have been proposed and won. They are seeking to include three types of users in this case: Proposers, Voters, and Community Advisors.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal's author has proposed 9 success metrics, which I believe are concrete, easy to assess, and encompass the complete target demographic, while also allowing the community to measure the proposal's progress to completion because it would be very easy to recognize success and failure.

f6_assessments.q0: Bringing marketers together to raise awareness, membership and participation aligns with the Cardano mission. To make the challenge excellent: better articulate how the challenge aligns with more than one of the Fund 8 Strategic Goals.
f6_assessments.q1: Experienced marketers exist within the Catalyst community and the budget is moderate compared to the total budget therefore this challenge is very feasible.
f6_assessments.q2: Success criteria and metrics should have included a multilingual aspect to broaden the outreach otherwise progress can be verified and measured.

f6_assessments.q0:
This challenge is about increasing the number of active proposers and participants to Catalyst. It is directly linked to #1 strategic goal for Fund 8 : "Prepare a group of people willing and able to make contributions to the ecosystem." 
This is indeed critical for Cardano's mission.
f6_assessments.q1:
No challenge team is identified yet, and, as stated by the challenge brief, this is probably required to effectively coordinate activities among proposers.
Apart from this, I can say from Catalyst Telegram talks and past funds proposals that the community will feel concerned by this challenge and has the skills to make relevant proposals.
I agree that the Catalyst community has the capacity to address this challenge.
f6_assessments.q2: Very specific metrics are listed, the most important one is probably the number of active Ideascale members. Other metrics (number of CA, VCA, number of countries represented) are relevant to measure the progress in Catalyst awareness, and easily measurable by Ideascale statistics. I strongly agree that success criteria and metrics enable an accurate measure of the progress in addressing the challenge.

importance: Project Catalystはまだまだ知られていません。連携したキャンペーンで認知度を高めれば、提案者、CA、有権者などの関心も高まるだろう。
success: Project Catalystを中心とした多様で成功したコミュニティを構築するために、あらゆるタイプの人材を惹きつけるマーケティング活動をコーディネートしました。
